channel.title: my life on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in my life on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: The New Thing
item.description: There’s lots of change going on in my life right now, and the most visible external indication of that is my job: April 15 was my last day at Creative Commons .

item.title: Perfection is not an option
item.description: My friend Andy, a successful organizational development consultant, moved to Ohio last year to pursue an MFA in playwriting.

item.title: Six Word Memoir
item.description: I received an email from my ninth grade English teacher a few days ago.

item.title: Done with Citi-First-Greg-Apartments
item.description: A few days ago I published a post about CitiApartments and 400 Duboce that’s been flagged “private” since January 5.

item.title: Ugly, Pretty, Special
item.description: Another example of the power of young adult fiction .

item.title: Ocean Beach Between the Storms
item.description: I spent an hour or so Saturday morning at Ocean Beach with my friend Scott , taking some pictures.

item.title: San Francisco Habitation, Take Two
item.description: Last week I took two days off work and, combined with the three day weekend, uprooted my San Francisco existence to date, relocating to the Dogpatch .

item.title: 400 Duboce #113, Now from “Greg Apartments”
item.description: So things are continuing to get a little weird at my current building.

item.title: Meta
item.description: My friend and colleague Vern used to joke that it was more fun to write code to help you write code than it was to actually write code.

item.title: Sugar Crème Küchen
item.description: I think this may be the first year ever that I’m not going to be in Indiana on Christmas Day.

item.title: Thanks, I Think
item.description: My vanity Google Alert turned up something a little strange today.

item.title: Communication and Trust
item.description: This afternoon I left work early to visit my landlord and try to iron out an issue that I’ve been dealing with for over two weeks.

item.title: Aimee Mann at Hardly Strictly Bluegrass
item.description: Sunday the weather in San Francisco shifted from San Francisco Autumn back to, well, San Francisco Summer: cool, windy, and clear; sunshine that imparts far less warmth than you might imagine.

item.title: Pet Shop Boys at The Warfield, San Francisco
item.description: Wednesday evening I continued my ten year concert reunion with the Pet Shop Boys .

item.title: Tori Amos at The Paramount, Oakland
item.description: Monday I saw Tori Amos at The Paramount, Oakland (setlist ).

item.title: Prop 8 Candlelight Vigil
item.description: As I mentioned yesterday , I’m in Cambridge through this evening.

item.title: The Day After
item.description: Last week I attended a meeting at Yale and had planned to spend the weekend with Matt and Alex in New York, flying back on Monday (the 3rd).

item.title: First World Problems
item.description: I did a closet purge today and wound up with four garbage bags of clothes to donate.

item.title: Overheard
item.description: At the laundromat this morning, waiting for the cover for my sofa to dry.

item.title: This Week
item.description: Things that I’ve done in the past seven days:

item.title: Relocated
item.description: Months sooner than I initially expected, I find myself living in San Francisco.

item.title: Pending Changes
item.description: I’ve avoided writing anything detailed about the changes happening in my life for a while now, mostly out of fear of “jinxing” something (and because I needed to get to a place where I was OK just talking about some of them).

item.title: I almost forgot…
item.description: (well, not really) …I’m an uncle now.

item.title: Get Out!
item.description: Today is National Coming Out Day.

item.title: Geeks + Booze
item.description: If you’re a geek in the Fort Wayne area, join us on Monday, October 2, 2006, for the first booze-enabled Geek Dinner .

item.title: Pixel Creek, redux
item.description: A while back I blogged about my crappy, crappy experience with a local company Pixel Creek , who happens to be an authorized Apple Service Provider.

item.title: Hometown Pride
item.description: My hometown, Bluffton, Indiana , is featured in today’s USA Today .

item.title: On my way…
item.description: So I spent last week in sunny Key West for a post-graduation, much needed vacation.

item.title: The Long View
item.description: If you want a thorough fisking of our esteemed President’s radio address yesterday (dedicated to the Federal Marriage Amendment , natch, because that’s the most pressing issue we face as a country), see Ted’s blog entry .

item.title: Goodbye, Craig
item.description: It seems like I just did this for Tina , but I got the call today, about Craig.

item.title: Educated. Officially.
item.description: So it’s official: I am educated.

item.title: Finally Final Finals
item.description: It’s a little surreal, and more than a little overwhelming, but this is finals week at school.

item.title: Pixel Creek: When you absolutely want the very worst
item.description: So last week the new Mac Mini developed a problem.

item.title: Yes, but who’s writing the check?
item.description: I’m in my last semester of undergraduate work, and between a full time school load and full time work load, some things fall through the cracks.

item.title: Reasons To Dislike Children — #5,436 and #5,437
item.description: Updated December 29, 2009

item.title: Pedro + PyCon = A Good Week
item.description: So yet another reason to be excited about PyCon coming up at the end of the month: I just snagged tickets to see Pedro The Lion while I’m in Dallas.

item.title: When it rains, it pours
item.description: It’s never an isolated incident ; yesterday I received a note from another family member that included the sentence:

item.title: One Step Forward, Two Steps Back
item.description: I had dinner with my grandfather last night.

item.title: Amoebas
item.description: Went to Amoeba Records on Haight Street with a local friend last night.

item.title: To San Francisco, by way of Dallas and lovely Amarillo
item.description: I’m working at Creative Commons San Francisco office this week.

item.title: It’s a start…
item.description: We’ve been enjoying something of an Indian Summer for the past few weeks here in Indiana.

item.title: What’s The Point?
item.description: Just watched the Six Feet Under series finale again.

item.title: Bad Mood Monday
item.description: I’m in a bitter, foul mood this morning after yesterday’s news .

item.title: I Miss Tina
item.description: It’s hard to know how to begin an entry like this.

item.title: Coworking… that’s a good word for it
item.description: Mike pointed out that I’m not the only one who doesn’t love working from home — well, the isolation part of it, at least.

item.title: Software, Entrepreneurs, and Mental Health
item.description: Drunken Blog is running an interview with Wil Shipley , founder of The Omni Group and more recently Delicious Monster .

item.title: That’s Mr. Champion To You!
item.description: So Wednesday night the previously unthinkable happened.

item.title: Recurring Problems
item.description: I wrote a post last December about what I consider the mixed blessing of my work with CC: that while I love what I’m doing, I hate that I do it by myself.

item.title: I Repeat: Word is Not an HTML Editor
item.description: Gay Pride in Fort Wayne has been something of an oxymoron since it’s inception.

item.title: I’m Lucky
item.description: I’m in San Francisco this week, working at the CC office.

item.title: 30 days of my life
item.description: Well, it’s not 10 years , but I’m launching a little experiment in introspection and self improvement.

item.title: Samson
item.description: http://www.flickr.com/photos/nathan_y/13086943/ My Mom and Dad have always been taken with our dogs, Bosco and Madeline.

item.title: I Don’t Understand
item.description: So the citizens of Kansas decided that laws aren’t laws until their enshrined in the constitution and voted to ban gay marriage .

item.title: Life News
item.description: Last time I visited by physician for my quarterly meds check, I mentioned the fact that I frequently feel fatigued and exhausted by mid-morning.

item.title: Secrets
item.description: All Things Considered had a story yesterday on PostSecret , a web site which invites people to send in postcards with their deepest secrets, and have them posted online.

item.title: Quality Stunt Radio
item.description: As with most trends, I’ve come to Pod-casting late.

item.title: Front Row Seat to Hate
item.description: Just a short note, for the record, so to speak.

item.title: Vacation’s Over, Back to the Cold
item.description: Garrett and I spent the past week on vacation in Florida.

item.title: What, you want to EAT?
item.description: So I’m a little pissed this morning.

item.title: Reading about Writing
item.description: I think it was as shocking to me as it was to Garrett when I confessed “I really want to be a writer,” on our second date.

item.title: Best Buy Redeemed?
item.description: Bryan, Best Buy may have redeemed themselves in your eyes, but they’re still pure evil.

item.title: Holiday Wrap Up
item.description: I survived the holidays, yet again.

item.title: People Can Change. Sort of.
item.description: My family’s evolving reaction to my sexuality is a continual source of learning and frustration.

item.title: And it really, really works
item.description: So I’m sitting here at the car dealership, waiting for Garrett’s car to be serviced, working on my final paper for “Religion and Culture”.

item.title: Irrational Fears
item.description: I place way too much importance on what people think about me.

item.title: Simple Pleasures
item.description: My favorite local coffee shop finally added free Wi-Fi.

item.title: Loneliness
item.description: My birthday was a couple weeks ago.

item.title: Remembering World AIDS Day
item.description: Today is World AIDS Day .

item.title: What’s New
item.description: I just realized that it’s been over two weeks since I last posted, so here’s a quick run down of what I’ve been up to.

item.title: We are so fucked
item.description: I’ d like to provide some pithy, insightful commentary on the election, but frankly, I’m in a state of shock(“23% of my people voted for him?

item.title: The Holidays… Already?
item.description: My 7 loyal readers may remember that the holidays are not my favorite time of year.

item.title: I may be lazy, but…
item.description: You know, Matt’s right ; PayPal really is for the lazy.

item.title: Peaches & Cream
item.description: Dogpoet (whom I have envied from afar for picking up and moving to NYC) makes an interesting comment about his new life in NYC.

item.title: Debate Watch
item.description: I listened to the Presidential debate last night on NPR , and just like the vice-presidential debate , the question I found most interesting regarded gay marriage.

item.title: Volleyball Update
item.description: As I’ve reported before, Garrett and I play volleyball in a city league .

item.title: A Cloud for Every Silver Lining
item.description: This weekend was the 16th annual Lesbian and Gay Dinner Dance (whose webpage hasn’t been updated in, well, a while, but you get the gist), a local benefit for the AIDS Task Force.

item.title: Veep-stakes
item.description: I watched most of the vice presidential debates last night and the only real suprise to me was the brief exchange over the issue of Gay Marriage.

item.title: How to maintain your monopoly
item.description: This afternoon I had the strangest experience.

item.title: What a Night
item.description: Last night’s concert was absoluting amazing.

item.title: Preparations
item.description: After being under the weather yesterday, I’m feeling better today.

item.title: “follow your heart”
item.description: Meg has decided to become a chef .

item.title: Diversity in Action
item.description: Last month I had the opportunity to take part in a panel discussion at IPFW where we talked about diversity and issues which resident assistants in the new student housing should be aware of.

item.title: I am so ignorant
item.description: I’m taking “Religion & Culture” this semester, which is turning out to be the most informative and simultaneously humbling class I’ve ever had the privilege to take.

item.title: Great, I’m Gretchen’s Project Now
item.description: This semester I’m taking Religion and Culture, a 100 level Philosophy class which fills in a required “humanistic thought” elective.

item.title: Summer, er, Fall, Reading List
item.description: I go into every summer (actually every “break,” be it summer, christmas, etc) thinking I’m going to catch up on my reading.

item.title: I blame Paige Davis
item.description: One of the largely overrated joys of home ownership is home improvement projects.

item.title: Big Changes
item.description: I haven’t blogged much since OSCON.

item.title: I’m Paying Them to Treat me This way?
item.description: Garrett and I recently consolidated our health insurance, and as a result I’m switching physicians.

item.title: The Sweet Taste of Victory
item.description: Last night our volleyball team, now dubbed the “Big Shots,” played our first matches of the second summer season.

item.title: We are unstoppable
item.description: Gay marriage.

item.title: Irrational Exuberance
item.description: You may have heard that Apple released a new version of the iPod this week.

item.title: My Week in SF
item.description: Today is my last day in the office here at CC.

item.title: 1,095 down
item.description: Friday night Garrett and I celebrated our 3rd anniversary.

item.title: Physically Meeting? That’s So 1998
item.description: I’m in San Francisco for the next week.

item.title: Two Weeks In, No Looking Back
item.description: Yesterday marked the two week point since I started working semi-full-time at Creative Commons .

item.title: Well that was anti-climactic
item.description: Yesterday afternoon Garrett and I officially became domestic partners, if not in the eyes of the law, then in the eyes of Purdue University , his employer.

item.title: Boring Software
item.description: Yesterday morning I had a meeting with an accountant.

item.title: We Won!
item.description: Tonite our sand volleyball team, the poorly name “Hot Shots”, won our first game this season.

item.title: Becoming Common
item.description: In a recent post I alluded to changes that were coming soon.

item.title: Just what is he doing?
item.description: Well the cadet’s got a great ass, but I’m not sure this is the sort of move I want to see our president making.

item.title: Not a Diva, in a good way
item.description: Last night Garrett and I saw Shania Twain in concert at the Memorial Coliseum here in Fort Wayne.

item.title: Finals Week
item.description: So I’ve made it through to finals week, once again taking 9 hours of classes on top of working full time.

item.title: Hello, Brothers; Goodbye, Liver
item.description: I spent the majority of the weekend in Lafayette with my fraternity brothers.

item.title: Random Life Notes
item.description: Just a couple of things I’ve been thinking about lately that haven’t been serious enough to warrant their own entry.

item.title: A Funny Thing Happened On The Way to the Conference
item.description: This morning I was walking from the hotel to the conference when the weirdest thing happened to me: I was cruised .

item.title: Woodshop 101
item.description: After my rousing (well, passable) success with the picture frame project, I’d have been happy to let the tools gather dust in the basement.

item.title: The Fruits of my Labor
item.description: |image0| Weeks after purchasing and installing the wood working equipment in my basement (which was generally dubbed “out of character” to say the least), I have something to show for.

item.title: Half-Measures & Half-Truths
item.description: My birthday falls about 45 days before New Year’s Eve, and as such I tend to spend the last month-point-five thinking about resolutions.

item.title: Happy Groundhog Day
item.description: …and happy birthday, Ben Purkis; wherever you are.

item.title: And they say we’re bad for marriage
item.description: So the American Family Association ran a poll on gay marriage last month, asking surfers whether they support gay marriage, support gay marriage but prefer the phrase “civil union” or oppose gay marriage.

item.title: Whats Going On
item.description: Today is my first day back after a two week winter break from work and school.

item.title: Those People
item.description: This week, under the stress of finals and the holidays, I finally cracked.

item.title: I’m glad that’s over
item.description: I just finished my final paper for Intermediate Expository Writing.

item.title: A Few (Musical) Notes
item.description: I’ve been busy with papers and exams for school the past few days, but am happy that I turned in my final research paper last night.

item.title: Ahh… the holidays
item.description: I really detest the holidays.

item.title: I’m too old for this
item.description: This weekend my chapter of Delta Lambda Phi held initiation in West Lafayette .

item.title: I’m Thankful it’s over
item.description: Working at your high school alma mater gives you some unique perspective.

item.title: Back in Indiana
item.description: I made it back to Indiana last night after an absolutely hellish day of travel.

item.title: Bound for the Keys
item.description: I had hoped to fix some bugs relating to the new Mozilla Firebird Pinstripe theme in mozCC tonite, but it was not to be.

item.title: What a weekend
item.description: I never thought I’d say this, but I’m almost glad it’s Monday.

item.title: A Lovely, Lazy Weekend
item.description: Well it’s Sunday evening, and I just realized what a lovely weekend it was.
